Empires & Puzzles Costumed Ignazio Review: The Flame Surgeon

Ignazio returns with a medical license and a massive stat boost. The 'Medic' costume transforms the classic conductor into a frontline surgeon. With upgraded healing, better buffs, and modern durability, is he now the best Red healer in the game? We break down the diagnosis.
Costumed Ignazio Review: The Doctor Will Burn You Now
Costumed Ignazio: The Flame Surgeon – A Successful Operation?

Ignazio has traded his conductor's baton for a... laser scalpel? Released in May 2025, the "Medic" costume breathes new life into the Super Elemental healer. This costume addresses the biggest complaint about the original—aging stats—and turbocharges his support capabilities. He is now a
, significantly tankier, and ready to compete with the latest heavy hitters. This review focuses on the

The art shift is drastic. Gone is the flamboyant suit; in its place is a sleek, sci-fi medical uniform with a futuristic visor. He looks less like he's leading an orchestra and more like he's about to perform emergency surgery in the middle of a starship battle. It’s a cool, modern look that fits the "advanced tech" vibe of recent costumes.
The upgrade is undeniable. The costume pushes his base stats to modern elite levels:
Compared to the base version (and even many 2024 heroes), Costumed Ignazio is a fortress. He can survive the punishment that would turn regular Ignazio to ash.
"Cauterizing Flame" is a straight upgrade over "Purifying Flame" in every mathematical sense.
The base heal is bumped to
. This raises his "floor" (bad board performance) and his "ceiling" (good board performance). A 60% heal at Fast speed is effectively a full reset for your team.
The attack buff is increased to
. While 5% seems small, in damage calculations, every percentage point counts.
and Fast speed, which were already the best parts of his kit.
A hero with 3000 HP gets healed for
at max potential. That is staggering.
This is the hidden weapon. His tile damage against Green enemies is not just "high," it's "nuclear." With his high base attack stat + 150% bonus, three tiles can often kill a Green hero outright.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Super Elemental family bonus remains, but the passives get a costume-flavored boost.
The Power Gem mechanic remains the same—spawn gems that deal chip damage. It's fine, but not the main event.
extra damage to weaker element (up from 100% on base). This makes him arguably one of the best tile-damage heroes in the game against Green titans or tanks.
damage from stronger element (up from 10% on base). This makes him significantly harder for Blue stacks to kill.
At the start of battle, damage from Special Skills is reduced. Combined with his Paladin class and high stats, this ensures he almost never gets "one-shot" by a sniper before he can move.
The base Ignazio was great but faded as stats exploded. The Costume was released to bring him back to the top of the meta.
This costume is the definition of "keeping up with the Joneses." It doesn't introduce a new mechanic, it just pumps the numbers so high that he becomes relevant again.

There are very few Red healers who offer this combination of speed, survivability, and offensive buffs. He competes directly with Hathor and Phenexa, and in offensive stacks, he might even surpass them due to the tile damage passive.
Monk Class, Lower Stats, Lower Heal Cap (55%), +50% Atk.
Paladin Class, Modern Stats, Higher Heal Cap (60%), +55% Atk.
The Costume is superior in 95% of situations. The only argument for the Base version is the
class (chance to resist ailments). However, the Costume's raw bulk usually outweighs the chance to resist. Use the Costume.
As a Paladin, he gets the defensive boost chance when taking damage.
Makes him nearly unkillable. Paladin class + high defense stats means he can tank hits from even the strongest snipers.
Less tile damage, but the +150% passive is usually enough anyway.
Maximizes the +150% passive. Against Titans, this is the way to go.
if you primarily use him for Titans or rush attacks.
The +150% passive makes red tiles lethal against green.
Still the gold standard for utility.
While the floor is higher (28%), he still craves red tiles to reach his full potential.
Like the base, he heals then cleanses, which can be an issue against healing reduction.
He is a staple red healer.
With his boosted stats and Paladin class, he is now a viable Flank or even Tank.
Absolute monster against Green Titans due to the passive.
His passive reduces Blue damage by 25%. Put him next to a hero that buffs defense, and Blue stacks will struggle to scratch him.
C. Ignazio buffs attack and deals massive tile damage. Marjana drops defense. Buster increases damage taken. The tile damage alone will shred the Titan.
Heroes that change tile colors (like Ratatoskr or Jott on the enemy team) reduce his healing potential by removing Fire shields.
If you are lucky enough to get the costume, you have won the lottery. This hero can carry you through the entire game. Prioritize him over almost any other Red hero.

Costume Ignazio replaces your outdated red healers. Even if you have Hathor, Ignazio's tile damage output gives him a unique edge in offensive raids. He is absolutely worth the Limit Break mats to maximize that Paladin bulk.
The community reaction to the costume was mixed initially due to the release timing ("Way too soon!").
However, players quickly realized the power: "In costume, he is improved a lot... with red tiles you will see crazy damage especially in green heroes, they melt."
Some users felt the power creep was too blatant: "Why is a Costume clearly stronger than the base form without no weakened or reduced parts?"
Despite the complaints about release schedules, the consensus is clear: "With costume, he’s going to get back in the game."

Costume Ignazio is the result of modern medicine meeting ancient magic. He fixes every flaw of the original and adds a layer of titanium armor. He heals, he cleanses, he buffs, and he punches through green heroes like they are made of paper. The doctor is in, and the prognosis for your enemies is terminal.
A must-have upgrade. If you have the costume, wear it.
